original_title: Crafting Ribbon Cables for Retro Hardware
original_content:
Building a modern computer is something plenty of us have done, and with various tools available to ensure that essentially the only thing required of the end user is to select parts and have them delivered via ones favorite (or least expensive) online retailer. Not so with retro hardware, though. While some parts can be found used on reselling sites like eBay, often the only other option is to rebuild parts from scratch. This is sometimes the best option too, as things like ribbon cables age poorly and invisible problems with them can cause knock-on effects that feel like wild goose chases when troubleshooting. Heres how to build your own ribbon cables for your retro machines.
[Mike] is leading us on this build because hes been working on an old tower desktop hes calling Rosetta which he wants to be able to use to host five different floppy disk types and convert files from one type to another. Of course the old hardware and software being used wont support five floppy disk drives at the same time so he has a few switches involved as well. To get everything buttoned up neatly in the case hes building his own ribbon cables to save space, especially since with his custom cables he wont have the extraneous extra connectors that these cables are famous for.
Even though, as [Mike] notes, you cant really buy these cables directly anymore thanks to the technologys obsolescence, you can still find the tools and parts youd need to create them from scratch including the ribbon, connectors, and crimping tools. Even the strain relief for these wide, fragile connectors is available and possible to build into these projects. It ends up cleaning up the build quite nicely, and he wont be chasing down any gremlins caused by decades-old degraded multi-conductor cables. And, even though [Mike] demonstrated the floppy disk drive cables in this build, ribbon cable can be used for all kinds of things including IDE drive connectors and even GPIO cables for modern electronics projects.
title: 自分で作れる！レトロな機器に必要なリボンケーブル
body: 「Retro Hardware」の様に、現代のコンピューターを作成するために必要なツールが、古いカスタムハードウェアを作成するためには必要ではありません。[Mike]は、古いタワーデスクトップを改造して、「Rosetta」と呼ぶ機能をつけたいと考え日本独自のリボンケーブルを作成しました。リボンコネクタの接続問題を回避するための、カスタムケーブルを作成することができます。このカブルにより、ビルドをきれいにすることができ、マルチコンダクターケーブルが劣化することによるグレムリンの追跡が不要になります。
